data.question: What is the empirical formula of the compound synthesized in the study?
What method was used for the synthesis of (H2dab)[Zn2(ox)3]·6H2O?
What are the crystal systems for 1·6H2O and 1·2H2O, respectively?
What is the role of 1,4-diaminobutane in the synthesis of (H2dab)[Zn2(ox)3]·6H2O?
data.answer: It acts as a counterion in the voids of the honeycomb framework

data.question: How does the MOF demonstrate selectivity towards hydroxyl group containing guests?
data.answer: By having both hydrogen-bonding donor and acceptor sites that form two types of hydrogen bonds concurrently with hydroxyl groups

data.question: What is the significance of the adsorption behavior of EtOH over MeCN and MeCHO?
data.answer: It demonstrates the MOF's complete selectivity in adsorption for EtOH due to its proticity, despite similar boiling points with MeCN

data.question: Is the crystal structure of 1·6H2O determined using single-crystal X-ray diffraction?
Does the MOF adsorb hydroxylic guests larger than EtOH?
Is the adsorption behavior of H2 and N2 observed in the MOF?
Does the MOF show a gate-open type absorption behavior?
Are the hydrogen atoms in 1·6H2O refined with isotropic thermal factors?
Is the void volume of 1·4MeOH estimated to be 40.8% by PLATON?
Was the thermal stability of the framework of 1, (H2dab)[Zn2(ox)3], given as 300 °C?
What is the role of oxalate ions in the structure of (H2dab)[Zn2(ox)3]·6H2O?
data.answer: Oxalate ions bridge zinc ions to form an infinite two-dimensional layer framework

data.question: What is the significance of the adsorption/desorption isotherms measured for the MOF?
data.answer: They demonstrate the MOF's selective adsorption towards protic guests and its ability to form multiple hydrogen bonds with hydroxyl groups

data.question: What was the temperature used for the hydrothermal synthesis of (H2dab)[Zn2(ox)3]·6H2O?
What is the crystal system of 1·6H2O?
What is the role of zinc oxide in the synthesis of (H2dab)[Zn2(ox)3]·6H2O?
data.answer: Zinc oxide acts as a source of zinc ions, which are octahedrally coordinated by oxalate ions in the MOF structure

data.question: Does the MOF selectively adsorb MeOH and EtOH over MeCN and MeCHO due to their proticity?
Is the adsorption of H2O in the MOF indicative of its ability to form stoichiometric dihydrate and hexahydrate phases?
